alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:53AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Randolph, eastern Lewis, southeastern Braxton, Upshur, northern Webster, Barbour and south central Harrison Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 152 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jackson Mill to near Rock Cave to near Sutton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Belington, Mill Creek, Dailey, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Beverly, Junior, Jane Lew, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Montrose, Alexander, Eden, Helvetia, Cleveland and Pickens. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 97 and 106. Route 19 near mile marker 66. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur
